attributes.action: display the Union Jack which was taken to the moon in 1969 in a public area.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Next year (2009) will mark the 40th anniversary of the successful landing on the moon by US astronauts, Neil Armstrong and Edwin "Buzz" Aldrin.

Accompanying the US flag on that mission, was also a small flag from the UK, which was then returned to earth and presented to Harold Wilson by the USA, along with several small pieces of moon rock.

This flag is now on display, but in private within 10 Downing Street.

To mark the anniversary, and promote the UK government's recent increased interest in lunar research projects - this petition asks that the government temporarily put the flag and moon rock on public display in a suitable location (or on a national tour) so that the public can see how Britain has already symbolically been to the moon.
